content:
It struck without warning and was probably the result of an underwater landslide

AROUND 10pm on Saturday a tsunami rolled up the Sunda Strait, which separates two of Indonesia’s biggest islands. It hit South Lampung, on the southern-most tip of Sumatra, and Pandeglang, on the western coast of Java. The tsunami came without warning and left towns and villages devastated. A three-metre-high wave crushed vehicles and razed buildings. The death toll stands at 222 at the time of publication. Over 800 people have been reported injured.

tsunamis are common in Indonesia. The archipelago forms part of the Pacific Ocean’s “Ring of Fire”. Earthquakes routinely rattle the country. Of the 200 or so earthquakes of magnitude 6 or more that have taken place across the world over the past two years, around a tenth have struck Indonesia. In August an earthquake shook the island of Lombok, near Bali, leaving 500 dead. Some of the quakes cause tsunamis. In September an earthquake and tsunami in Central Sulawesi killed over 2,000 people. A tsunami in 2004 flattened huge swathes of north Sumatra, causing about 220,000 deaths.

This disaster had an unusual trigger. According to the national geological agency, it may have been caused by an eruption of Anak Krakatau (“Child of Krakatoa”), a small volcanic atoll located in the Sunda Strait, where a much larger volcano known in the west as Krakatoa once stood. Although the original Krakatoa was obliterated in a gigantic eruption in 1883, Anak Krakatau emerged from the waters of the strait 44 years later and remains an active volcano. Magma it ejected may have displaced colder rock and caused an underwater landslide, which in turn precipitated the tsunami.

That may explain why locals received no warning: the tsunami-alert system is based on detecting earthquakes rather than eruptions. That is not the only factor which has increased the death toll. It is holiday season in Indonesia and Pandeglang is a popular spot for tourists. Its white-sand beaches are promoted as part of Indonesia’s tourism campaigns. Most of the fatalities reported so far have occurred there. These include the bassist of an Indonesian pop band which was playing a gig on the beach when the wave hit, as well as members of the audience.

Rescue teams will spend the next few weeks sorting through the rubble. The number of fatalities will probably climb further as more victims are found. Efforts to rebuild broken communities will take much longer. Emergency response teams will have to focus on providing food and shelter to those in need. After the disaster in Sulawesi, a lack of basic sustenance sparked a spate of looting. The spread of disease is another concern. Health officials in Lombok declared a state of Emergency in September after the earthquake there because of an outbreak of malaria. Sadly, Indonesia has much experience to draw on when responding to tectonic disasters.

我总是随身多带点现金以备急需。

政府已被授予应急权力。

她把脚从自行车的踏板上抬开，沿山坡滑行而下。
The plane coasted down the runway.
飞机顺着跑道平稳滑行。
He coasted through his final exams.
他毫不费劲地通过了期终考试。
You're just coasting─it's time to work hard now.
你根本是在应付，现在该努力干了。

ex: vt. 毁灭；毁坏
eg2: The upshot is that we’re horrifyingly nonchalant at the prospect that rising carbon emissions may devastate our favorite planet.
关键是，我们对于不断增加的碳排放可能毁坏我们地球家园的前景采取了可怕的漠视态度。
Monsoons, droughts, depleted groundwater resources, and typhoons devastate poor countries because they’re in too deep a hole economically to reduce their risk, he says.
他说，季风、干旱、枯竭的地下水资源和台风给贫困国家带来了毁灭性的灾难，因为它们深陷经济泥潭而无力减轻风险。

eg2: If we electrify the electronic device, the electric current will cause the electrons to  quickly...
如果我们使这个电子设备通电，那么．电流会使电子快速喷射…
So if we can figure out the binding energy, we can also figure out how much energy we have to put into our atom in order to a eject or ionize an electron.
所以如果我们可以计算出结合能，我们也可以计算出,我们需要注入多少能量到原子中,去逐出或电离一个电子。
So we see that we do not eject electrons in the case of the laser pointer, even if we have this intensity, it is still not related to the energy of an individual photon, so we won't see an effect.
所以我们看到我们用激光笔,还是没有逐出电子，即使我们有这样的强度，它仍然与一个单个的光子能量无关,所以我们不会看到光电效应。

人类有衣、食、住的需求。
to take shelter from the storm
躲避暴风雨
The fox was running for the shelter of the trees.
狐狸朝树丛跑，想要躲藏起来。
People were desperately seeking shelter from the gunfire.
人们拼命地找地方躲避炮火。
They built a rough shelter from old pieces of wood.
他们用旧木条搭了一个简陋的窝棚。
an air-raid shelter
防空洞
a night shelter for the homeless
无家可归者夜间收容所
an animal shelter
动物收容处
Trees shelter the house from the wind.
树给房子挡住了风。
helping the poor and sheltering the homeless
帮助贫穷者，庇护无家可归者
Perhaps I sheltered my daughter too much(= protected her too much from unpleasant or difficult experiences) .
也许我对女儿保护过度了。
We sheltered from the rain in a doorway.
我们在一处门廊里避雨。

ex: n. 火花；电火花；火星；活力
v. 引发；触发；冒火花；飞火星
网络 斯巴达克；斯帕克；斯巴克
eg2: A shower of sparks flew up the chimney.
烟囱里飞出无数火星。
sparks from a faulty light switch
漏电的电灯开关发出的火花
A spark ignites the fuel in a car engine.
汽车发动机中的燃料由火花点燃。
a spark of hope
一线希望
As a writer he seemed to lack creative spark.
作为作家，他似乎缺少创作激情。
the sparks of revolution
革命的导火线
Sparks flew at the meeting(= there was a lot of argument) .
会上争论激烈，火星四溅。
The proposal would spark a storm of protest around the country.
这一提案将引发全国性的抗议浪潮。
Winds brought down power lines, sparking a fire.
大风刮断电线，引起了火灾。
The riots were sparked off by the arrest of a local leader.
骚乱是因逮捕一名当地领导人而触发的。
a sparking, crackling fire
噼啪直响、火星飞迸的火
The game suddenly sparked to life.
比赛突然变得激烈起来。

ex: n. 洪水；一阵；大雨；突然迸发

wp.Kate spate: 凯特·丝蓓手袋;波点长裤;推荐单品波点长裤

eg2: So how should we take the  of new green announcements from the world's major oil firms?
所以我们该如何看待这些世界主要石油公司发出的一连串绿色新宣言呢？
Yet hopes are rising that the recent spate of deals might indicate a genuine turning point in the merger market.
然而希望正在出现，最近的收购潮或许意味着一个真正的拐点正出现在收购市场中。
Not only is it unusual for the BOJ board to reject proposals from a governor or a deputy governor, the meeting also came alongside the release of a  of bleak data.
不仅是日本央行委员会否决央行总裁或副总裁提议的情况十分罕见,此次会议前公布的的众多数据表现黯淡的情况也很少见.

wp.struck out: 三击出局;三击不中出局;原意指出局

ex: adj. 受罢工影响的
v. 罢工，打击，撞击（strike的过去式和过去分词）
n. (Struck)人名；(英)斯特拉克；(瑞典)斯特鲁克；(德)施特鲁克
eg2: He hit me, so I struck him back.
他打了我， 所以我才还手打他。
They struck for more pay.
他们为增加薪金而罢工。
She struck a glass of wine in my hand.
她一掌打落了我手中的一杯酒。

ex: n. 食物；生计；支持
eg2: The tundra is also home to caribou, an important source of  in regions such as Alaska's North Slope.
那里也是驯养北美驯鹿的地方，也是某些地区例如阿拉斯加的北坡的重要生计来源。
He was there befriended by a dog, who brought him sustenance and licked the sores on his leg until he was healed.
在那里，一只狗经常为他带来食物，并帮他舔腿上的伤口直到他病愈。 他们成了朋友。
As the ancestors of early humans turned to meat for , they were able to grow larger brains which in turn enabled them to make more sophisticated tools.
随着人类的早期祖先转向以肉类为食物，他们的大脑就能够长得更大，这又反过来使得他们能够制造更为复杂的工具。

vi. 鸣钟；征税
eg2: "These are very tough times for hardworking families, but the  would be far worse if we had not acted, " he said.
“现在对于努力工作的家庭来讲是艰难时期，但如果我们不采取任何措施，代价会更大，”他说。

ex: n. 触发器；（枪的）扳机；（尤指引发不良反应或发展的）起因；引爆器
v. 触发；引起；发动；开动
网络 板机；触发程序；启动
eg2: to pull/squeeze the trigger
扣扳机
He kept his finger on the trigger.
他的手指一直勾着扳机。
The trigger for the strike was the closure of yet another factory.
触发这次罢工的是又一家工厂被关闭了。
nuclear triggers
核引爆器
Nuts can trigger off a violent allergic reaction.
坚果可以引起严重的过敏反应。
to trigger an alarm
触发警报器

ex: n. 海啸
网络 津波；大海啸；地震海啸

wp.Underwater Exploration: 水下探索;水下勘探;水下探测;水下探究
wp.underwater penetration: 入水深度;		透水深度;水中侵彻

eg2: But, if we are well trained, the  part of things is not really as harsh as you might think.
但是，如果我们受到良好的训练，水下部分的事情可能就不会真的像你想像的那么严酷。
They look like actors dancing or flying on an underwater stage.
他们就像是一群演员，正在一个水下舞台上起舞飞翔。

ex: n. 车辆；工具；交通工具
网络 媒介物；载体；运载工具
eg2: motor vehicles(= cars, buses, lorries/trucks, etc.)
机动车辆
Are you the driver of this vehicle?
你是这辆汽车的驾驶员吗？
rows of parked vehicles
一排排停放的车辆
Art may be used as a vehicle for propaganda.
艺术可以用作宣传的工具。
The play is an ideal vehicle for her talents.
这部戏是她施展才华的理想机会。

eg2: If a volcanic eruption wipes out all of the plain mice, the island will be repopulated by striped mice.
假设一次火山爆发消灭了所有的普通老鼠，那么这个小岛将是斑纹鼠的天下。
Our work was like that of geologists who compile the signs of an imminent earthquake or volcanic eruption.
我们的工作如同地质学家，我们收集一场即将到来的地震或火山爆发的迹象。
All places at the pacific trench, (the pacific ring of fire) should be evacuated now, because there will be earthquakes and volcanic explosions.
太平洋海沟的所有地方（太平洋火环带）应该立刻疏散，因为将有地震和火山爆发。

活火山会随时喷发。

休眠火山
an extinct volcano(= one that is no longer active)
死火山

Title: Another tsunami devastates Indonesia

paperStatistics.title: Another tsunami devastates Indonesia
paperStatistics.desc: It struck without warning and was probably the result of an underwater landslide
